notes: Beauty Shop was all over TV that winter, commercials and all, but I watched it a few times, more enthralled than I should have been. Then, at the end, to my surprise, I recognize that song... I heard that on my trip. Fumbled through my journal to prove it--I had scratched out some of the lyrics while driving around in valdosta, ga one morning.

title: Put Out
story:
A return to work at the end of '08 meant a return to myspace. As our band began scheduling gigs I began to get really interested in local bands, including those I remembered the names of from years past, whether or not they were still playing together, Baby Strange foremost among them.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/myspace #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
still drawing music from myspace at work, even after my 10 week hiatus, as we start playing out and i start to get really interested in local bands. eyes like knives, andrea gillis, brendan boogie, the luxury. met lagoon at around this time, too. bon savants? when did i see them and fall so hard? me and joan collins. barnicle too, maybe.

                    Freezepop, Barnicle, Bon Savants and The Toothaches at The Middle East was dec 12 08

                    brendan was at middle east down on dec 6 08... w/the luxury, me and joan collins, and i, pistol... i could have been at that show, and the one the next week. brendan's alone? then barnicle w/band?

title: What You're Doing
story:
Somehow the rest of the band convinced me to do a Rush cover as part of our set, narrowing the choice to about three from which I chose What You're Doing. We played it out a few times, first at TT's that February.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/file #media/cd.burned #format/mix.singing #player/computer.work.linux #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: somehow the rest of the band convinced me to do a rush cover as part of our set. they narrowed the choice to about three from which i chose this one. we played it out a few times, first at t.t.'s that february.

title: Blue Ridge Mountains
story:
I had heard a lot about Fleet Foxes from @spoth{Spoth} and perhaps others, and I even managed to catch them play one or two songs at the end of their set at Austin City Limits the previous year with Spoth, while traveling. Not until @q{Rob} bought in and let me borrow the disc, however, did I spent serious cycles on their music. I loved the whole vibe, but particularly Blue Ridge Mountains, near the end of the album, noting that not only did they pull off harmonies reminiscent of the CSN I loved so much, but the singer's voice even reminded me a bit of a young #music/artist{David Crosby}.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
i had heard a lot about fleet foxes from spoth and perhaps others, and i even managed to see them play one or two songs at the end of their set at the austin city limits music festival the previous year. it wasn't until rob bought it and let me borrow that i spent serious cycles on their music. i loved the whole vibe, but particularly blue ridge mountains near the end of the album.

                    i noted that not only did they pull off harmonies reminiscent of the csn but that the guy's voice even sounded a bit like a young david crosby.

                    Nov 24, 2009: told bbjones - specifically luke - that i was on the fleet foxes train, at least for their first album, not having heard the latest, if there even was a later one then.

title: Celebrate
story:
Ahead of sharing a bill with Heather Rose And The Drama that April at Felt Boston, I spent a lot of time on their myspace page, falling hard for a couple songs. #music/song{That Girl's A Machine} was about the most sextastic song I'd ever heard, but Celebrate was my favorite of theirs. When I told that to the drummer he said that was a most common favorite among those who disclose.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/myspace #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
the narrow channels played with heather rose and the drama from providence at felt boston.

                    ahead of playing with heather rose and the drama at felt boston i spent a lot of time on their myspace page, falling hard for a couple of the songs. that girl's a machine is about the most sextastic song i know of. celebrate is my favorite of theirs, though. the drummer said that was a common favorite amongst those who disclose to them.

title: Magnificent
story:
U2 had done it again, releasing another standalone jam that for whatever reason seemed like their best ever to me, a standing phenomenon for most of a decade, which I tried explaining to @steveo{Steveo} to some avail.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: u2 did it again--another standalone jam that sounds like the best they've ever sounded. i recall talking to steveo about this one at around the time it hit the radio. another compelling video.

title: Mad World
story:
@ryan.s{Ryan}, @greg{Greg}, @faust{Ben}, and I were in a routine of critiquing American Idol contestants and ranking them on a weekly basis, and there was no disagreement on Adam Lambert. He was just about the most captivating character we had seen on that stage, and that was kinda saying something, given we'd been all over the show since it began. Adam's rendition of #music/song{Ring Of Fire} was an instant classic, but only when he bested it a few weeks later with his take on Mad World did I start using the Internet to enjoy an Idol performance beyond the night it aired.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.performance #player/tv #player/computer.07
notes: adam lambert was just about the most captivating character i had seen on ai, and that's saying something, because i've been all over the show since it began. his ring of fire was classic instantly, but when he bested it a few weeks later with his take on mad world, i couldn't stop watching it on the internet.

title: Sail On, Sailor
story:
There was a melody I'd been singing to myself for quite some time that I believed belonged to a real song, some seventies era underground lost classic, but I never heard it on the radio, so I just couldn't place it. I carried it with me for years and doubted myself.

Vindication came in the spring of '09. The melody came pouring out of the TV during a crucial scene in The Departed, the words revealing themselves and providing the requisite clue. And the answer the Internet provided was even more satisfying. It was The Beach Boys: Sail On Sailor.

What made this answer so satisfying was that I had already fallen hard for one of their songs from the same era--#music/song{Feel Flows}, featured in Almost Famous. I wondered whether it was possible this incredibly popular band I hadn't paid much attention my whole life might be responsible for a wealth of music I would love and had yet to explore.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.movie #media/cd #format/collection #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
There was a melody that I'd been singing to myself for quite some time that I believed belonged to a real song in the world, some seventies era underground or lost classic. I carried this with me for years. Then that spring I caught most of The Departed on TV and the melody came pouring out the television as crucial accompaniment to a scene in the film. The words revealed themselves and I had the clue I needed. The Internet gave me the answer, an extremely satisfying one at that: it was The Beach Boys. The song Sail On Sailor.

                    That it was The Beach Boys was particularly great because I had already fallen hard for one of their seventies songs--Feel Flows. Was it possible this super-popular band that I hadn't paid much attention to my whole life might be responsible for a strain of music that I would love and had somehow gone undiscovered for so long?

                    at some time early that year i caught most of The Departed on tv and heard that song i'd been singing to myself and that i suspected existed for so long

                    i love thinking that there are those with much closer associations to this song and its actual release or anything to do with this song in the almost forty years between when it was released and when i truly discovered it.

title: Fireflies
story:
Fireflies was a radio song that sounded like a candy-coated, synthetic version of #music/artist{Death Cab}. @pete{Peter}, the Death Cab authority in my life, lent credence to this view by somewhat agreeing. Not to say I didn't love it though, because I did, rocking it as hard as I could at @andy.j{Andy J's} karaoke going away party.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes:
a radio song that i initially thought sounded a lot like death cab though clearly wasn't them... almost like whoever it was was trying to out death cab death cab. peter had the same feeling i recall after talking to him about it.

                    i did this karaoke at andy joynt's going away party that year.

                    another compelling video - the kid w/all his electronic old school toys coming to life in his room - that outdid almost every other video at the time and provided a reason to tune into the countdown.

title: Dragon Attack
story:
When one band dropped out of the Queen cover show @boogie{Brendan} hosted that June, the remaining bands were saddled with another song to learn. We got Dragon Attack though, so it kind of worked out.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/file #media/cd.burned #format/mix.singing #player/computer.work.linux #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: when one band dropped out of the queen cover show brendan hosted that June, the rest of us were saddled w/another song to learn. We got Dragon Attack, so things kind of worked out.

title: Always Works Out Wrong
story:
I left @rux{Rux's} Meat Night down in Myles Standish State Forest early that year to head into town and see The Good North reunion show at The Middle East Down. In anticipation I had The Good North EP on my computer at work, listening repeatedly to my favorite by a long shot, Always Works Out Wrong. When they opened with it I was both surprised and giddy.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #media/live.performance #format/album #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
I had The Good North EP on my computer at work, they were putting on a reunion show that June, I left Ruxton's Meat Night that year down in Myles Standish State Forest early to head into town and see them at the middle east down. Barnicle opened, and so got to see her too.

                    my fav good north song by kind of a long shot... i asked luke ahead of time if they'd be playing it, and he conceded, though he didn't tell me it was going to be first! what a jolt when it kicked in.

title: Nothing But A Miracle
story:
I bought Diane Birch's #music/album{Bible Belt} CD for @laura{Laura} for her birthday after hearing Nothing But A Miracle on the radio a few times. The song was a throwback to the 70s singer-songwriter style, with a feel otherwise absent from present day, featuring clever arrangement and a few chord changes that tapped me on the soul.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/cd #format/album #player/car.sitting.bull #player/stereo.laura.6.disc #gift.given
notes:
She brought something from seventies singer song writer sound that I hadn't heard... just a few of those chord progressions did that magical thing that most modern music doesn't seem to for me. I loved it. like she found that key that unlocks something in me. heard it on the radio a few times--just enough to suggest it was new and legit and not actually from the seventies or something. bought the cd for laura for her birthday that year.

                    remember hearing it on the way to a summer league ultimate game by car somewhere bewteen alewife and maynard.

title: I'm Not Over
story:
While traveling in '08 I heard a few times a particular new song I found myself quite liking. It once emanated from a passing car as I walked the city blocks of downtown Austin.

I never went looking for the song after returning home, and it kind of slipped my mind until the following summer. @tom.c{Cook} and I were on the open highway in the middle of the night en route to D.C. for @spoth{Spoth's} birthday when the song came on the radio, first time I'd heard it since my trip. This time was different, however--the voice was incredibly familiar. How could that be?

In the interim I'd become familiar with the videos and music of what I assumed was a band I'd never heard before, but it turned out the Carolina Liar from #music/song{Show Me What I'm Looking For} was the same band doing I'm Not Over. I couldn't wait to call @laura{Laura} the next morning and impart my revelation.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/myspace #player/car.sitting.bull #player/computer.work.linux
notes: While traveling I heard a few times a new song that I found myself really liking. I specifically remember catching it emanating from a passing car as I walked on the streets of downtown Austin. I never went looking for it after I got home, and it kind of slipped my mind until the following summer. On the way to D.C. for Spoth's birthday in a car with Cook, open highway, middle of the night, the song came on again, first time I'd heard it since my trip. This time, though, I recognized the voice as one I knew well. What had happened was, in the interrim, I had become familiar with videos and music from what I just assumed was a new band. Putting the pieces together, I discovered that I'm Not Over was the same Carolina Liar that did Show Me What I'm Looking For. I called Laura the next morning--couldn't wait to tell her. I spent a lot of time on their myspace page after that.

title: Panic Switch
story:
@jim{Jim} and I compared notes about the latest Silversun Pickups at Jackson's birthday party at @j{J} and @k{K's} that summer. I told him how much I loved Panic Switch, and that I thought it represented well for a sophomore effort, to which he responded excitedly - after learning I didn't have the album - that there were about five better songs than that on it. Despite that compelling review, I never looked into it, not quite falling for the next radio song. Sorry, Jim !

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes:
driving around maynard, back toward the house on 117 onto waltham st.

                    comparing notes with jim at jackson's party at j's and k's that summer. told him how much i loved the song, thought they were really representing for a second album effort, he said there were about 5 songs on the album better than that one, never looked into it, though. i didn't love the next radio song.

                    luke had put a silversun pickups song on one of his yousendit mixes.

                    saw this band live w/spoth at austin.

                    i was pretty convinced this was a female singing for a long while.

title: New Divide
story:
Linkin Park was getting more and more difficult to sing along with--the high held notes were just getting ridiculous. Loved the imagery though, of the divide, the ashes that fell like snow, and the ground that caved in between where we were standing.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes:
these are getting harder and harder to sing along with... that guy is getting ridiculous. still quite liked this jam, though. driveway at maynard, sitting in the car listening the song out.

                    love the imagery of the divide, the ashes fell like snow, ground caved in between where we were standing

title: Go All The Way
story:
And so began the Twilight phenomenon. @laura{Laura} and I went to see it before we knew it was based on a book, inspired solely by mild Internet hype, even before we'd seen any TV commercials for it, believe it or not. When I asked the teenage girl at the ticket booth whether it was any good she could barely contain herself, relishing the opportunity to provide an editorial film critique. Apparently it was so good.

I fell for the movie almost immediately, for the Pacific Northwest setting to which I had strong emotional ties, plus the music, which was fantastic. Loved the #music/artist{Mutemath} #music/song{Spotlight} reprise. And what a wonderful surprise to later find the high-energy emo dance song playing at the prom was Perry Farrell. That guy was everywhere!

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/theatre #media/cd #format/movie #format/soundtrack #player/stereo.laura.6.disc
notes: So begins the twilight phenomenon. Laura and I went to see it before we knew it was based on a book, solely on some Internet hype--don't even think I'd seen a TV commercial for it. When I asked the teenage ticket vendor whether it was good or not she could barely contain herself--she so relished the opportunity to perform the critical facet of her job. I fell for the movie because it was so northwest, a place I had strong emotional ties to.The music to the movie was fantastic. Loved the Mutemath reprise of... ? and what elation to learn that the great energy song playing at the school dance was Perry Farell--this guy is everywhere!

title: Enemy Among Us
story:
I took @laura{Laura} to see #music/artist{Paramore} at the House of Blues on Lansdowne for her birthday that year, where the opening act was a band I'd never heard of called Paper Route--safe to say they were the winners on the night. Paramore was good, but Paper Route blew expectations - none - out of the water.

One of the Paper Routers - skinny fellow with a bald head - was greeting people as they exited. I suspected most people didn't even pick up on that it was him, but I noticed, and relished the opportunity to look him in the eye and tell him, with as much conviction as I could muster, "you guys were badass." I picked up their CD before we left and listened to it a lot in the following months. The picture on the back of the album, of the kids laying on the hill sleeping - under a spell, perhaps - was exactly the way most of the album felt.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/car.laura.altima
notes: I took Laura to see Paramore at the House of Blues on Lansdowne Street  for her birthday that year. The opening act was a band I'd never heard of called Paper Route. I think it's safe to say they were the winners on the night. Paramore was good, but Paper Route blew non-existant expectations out of the water. One of the Paper Routers - skinny fellow w/a bald head - was greeting people as they exited. I suspected most people probably didn't even pick up on that it was him, but I noticed, and relished the opportunity to look him in the eye and tell him with as much conviction as I could muster "you guys were badass." I picked up their CD before we left and listened to it a lot in the following months. The picture of the kids laying on the hill sleeping or under a spell or whatever it was on the album art was exactly the way some of the music made me feel.

title: Busy Doin' Nothin'
story:
In November that year I sent @nick{Nick} an email asking what he knew about a list of Beach Boys songs I'd completely fallen for, including #music/song{Caroline No}, #music/song{Wonderful}, #music/song{Surf's Up}, and Busy Doin' Nothin'.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/collection #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
th nov 12, 09 email to nick subject: beach boys

                    ---
                    do you know anything about these beach boys songs?

                    caroline no
                    wonderful
                    surf's up
                    busy doin' nothin'
                    sail on sailor
                    'til i die
                    ---

                    i must have been loving that disc by this time at work

                    ---

                    or maybe "check my brain" aic?

title: February
story:
I went to @boogie{Brendan's} CD release party for #music/album{The Sweet And The Brutal} that December, and of course picked up a copy of the disc. I had liked February from when I first heard it posted online, for a contest almost a year prior, but the album version outdid that early take.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/computer.work.linux
notes: went to his cd release party that dec for the sweet and the brutal. met gavin and david there. i liked february from when i first heard it posted, a song he'd written for a contest, but the album version outdid that original.

title: Yell It Out
story:
Violet Nine also played at the release party for #music/album{The Sweet And The Brutal}, first time I'd ever heard of them, and I was taken, grateful there was a pretty girl was handing out copies of their old CD for free. I took one and listened to it extensively at work in the following months.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/computer.work.linux
notes: violet nine played at brendan's cd release party. i had never heard of them, but i really went for them. gavin and david didn't like them as much as i did. a pretty girl was handing out copies of their old cd, which i took and listened to extensively at work in the following months.

title: Empire State Of Mind
story:
Empire State Of Mind was the champion of the end of my VH1 Top 20 days. The program and I just drifted apart.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/vh1 #player/tv
notes: holdover from vh1 top 20 video days. love the city pride so much! and the story. such style this guy has.

title: Pancake
story:
A blog entry I wrote about Pancake that February explained it was on the verge of becoming my favorite song. It had just returned to the nighttime playlist for @laura{Laura} and I, playing the same role it did years before at The Beak, "layered and meandering as it prodded my brain in an escort to the dream world."

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/itunes #format/album #player/ipod.laura
notes: steal from the blog entry on the tnc site. i'm feeling this in my legs like afternoon coffee as i listen right now. it is so woven into me.

title: Laughing With
story:
Laughing With caught my attention on that trip to D.C. with @tom.c{Cook} the previous year, on the way down in the car in the middle of the night, same time I heard #music/song{I'm Not Over}. I bought the CD in late 2009 but never unwrapped it, and ended up including it my family grab gift to @ashley{Ashley}. I was going to get another one for myself, then realized I could probably find the song on myspace, which I did.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio.once #media/cd #media/myspace #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
I heard this for the first time on that trip the previous year to D.C. with Cook, on the way down in the car in the middle of the night. I bought this CD in late 2009 but never unwrapped it. I ended up including it my grab gift to Ashley, then realized, before buying another copy, that I could probably find it on myspace. success!

                    this song still floors me. love the play between the serious and lighthearted, all ironic and stuff.

title: Take Back The City
story:
I heard Take Back The City multiple times on the radio around that time - once heading out route 2, just breaking the 128 belt - half wondering if it was new, but suspecting it was not. It was to me. I found it on the Snow Patrol myspace page and listened to it there a lot, learning some of the rest of their catalog in the process.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/myspace #player/car.sitting.bull #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
heard this once or twice on the radio - out route 2 just breaking the128 belt -  which almost made me wonder if it was new though i suspected it may have been old. it was new to me. decided myspace works for popular bands too--found the song there and listened to it a lot, learning some of the rest of the snow patrol catalog in the process for not single song repeating or tapping back repeatedly.

                    always love people singing so fondly for their city.

title: Your Decision
story:
Alice In Chains came back some months before, and they sounded remarkably good for a band trying to make a comeback after more than a decade without their iconic front man, proving once and for all it was the evil harmonies that made them in the first place, no disrespect to Layne.

#music/song{Check My Brain} was first to hit the radio, with a well placed "California" in the lyrics (I love that for some reason), but as good as it was, the second single, Your Decision, was even better. @todd{Todd} and I got to talking about all of this, and he informed me he'd made plans to come down from Maine to see them at the Garden in March, further evidence of how much the band meant to him.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: Alice In Chains came back some months before, and they sounded remarkably good for a band trying to make a comeback after a decade or more without their iconic front man, thus proving it was the evil harmonies that made them what they were in the first place, no disrespect to Layne. Anyways, another song with a well played "California" in the lyrics - i love that - Check My Brain was good, but the second single, Your Decision, was even better. Todd told me he had plans to see them at the Garden in March that year.

title: Northern Star
story:
I was pulling for #music/artist{Siobhan Magnus} so hard on American Idol, and not just because she represented Massachusetts, though that was probably most of it. At a minimum, I liked her enough to look into Lunar Valve (and to include them here), her real world band from before she was a contestant.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/myspace #player/computer.07 #player/computer.work.linux
notes: I was pulling for Siobhan Magnus so hard, not just because she represented Massachusetts on American Idol, though that was probably mostly it. I did like her enough to dig into Lunar Valve, her real world band from before she was a contestant.

title: The High Road
story:
It took me until #music/album{Wincing The Night Away}, but I finally got way on board for #music/artist{The Shins}. I considered their lyrics unparalleled, a sort of modern day Joni Mitchell, if not for the style, then for the virtuosity.

High Road hit the radio after I'd already heard from @ryan.s{Ryan} that Broken Bells was one of the bands he was listening to these days, which he told me just outside The Courtside, on a night we were supposed to meet but only did for a minute--I had to catch the 10:50 back to Maynard just as he was arriving.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/myspace #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #player/car.sitting.bull #player/computer.07
notes:
It took me until Wincing The Night Away, but I was way on board for The Shins at that point. I think their lyrics are unparalleled on the leading edge, a sort of modern day Joni Mitchell, if not for style, simply for prowess. High Road hit the radio after I'd heard from Ryan that Broken Bells was one of the bands he was listening to--that was at the courtside well beyond its heyday on a night we were supposed to meet there but he couldn't make it until i was leaving to catch the 1050 back to maynard.

                    hearing this in the car w/eden and laura outside that karaoke place we witnessed but never ended up trying in the suds, i think... somewhere southwestish of maynard.

                    th apr 22 2010 on bbjones:

                    i listen to the high road and vaporize on the broken bells myspace page ~40 times a day.

title: Home
story:
Home was just a radio song, in the vogue of the time, trading the lead vocals back and forth between male and female. It reminded me a lot of the #music/artist{Rubber Rodeo} album I'd bought in the bin in New York City long before, actually.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: just a radio song, but in the vogue of the time--lead male and female trading vocals. this reminded me a lot of that rubber rodeo album i'd bought in the bin in nyc back in the day.

title: Crystalised
story:
The xx was a mention in discussing the latest music with @pete{Peter}, sitting in an Emerson Hospital waiting room the day he came to meet @sid{Sydney}.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes: follow the trend of the time--a radio song w/f   m trading back and forth. talked to peter about this in the waiting room after syd was born.

title: I Am Not A Robot
story:
@luke{Luke} posted a link to a video of I Am Not A Robot to a few friends, a different version than one I'd heard on the radio a couple times. When I wrote back to the group to say that, a discussion of the connotation of the word "ethereal" developed, to which @spoth{Spoth} contributed insight.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.sitting.bull
notes:
sat jul 4 post to bbjones:

                    i actually think she was on 92.5, but i've heard it a couple times, not sure if it was the same station each time...

                    then we got into a discussion about what the word ethereal connotes...

title: Vaporize
story:
I'd been listening to Vaporize for months - first on myspace, then on iTunes, then in the car on a burned CD - its greatness to my eyes only swelling as I absorbed the message to the extent I could. Ultimately it was nothing less than the anthem of a generation - mine - and particularly for this stage, well beyond teenage years.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/myspace #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #player/computer.07 #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
anthem!

                    yes, i'd been listening to this for months, but its greatness in my eyes continued to swell as i absorbed the message to the extent i could.

title: Letters From The Sky
story:
Letters From The Sky came on the radio a couple times while I was listening that July, just enough to get Civil Twilight roped into a 5-album iTunes purchase I made ahead of heading to the hospital with @laura{Laura} and @sid{Lentil}, renamed Sydney the day after we got there. I wasn't sure the song sustained on the radio until catching it again a month or so later, in @trav{Trav's} car, driving home from the fantasy football draft at @nick{Nick's} place in Auburndale.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/itunes #format/album #player/car.laura.altima #player/computer.07
notes:
Heard it a couple times on the radio, enough to go for it when I bought 5 albums through iTunes just ahead of heading to the hospital for lentil.

                    loved it on first listen.

                    Heard it in trav's car driving home from the draft at nick's (pretty sure that's what it was... or did we have a summer meeting?).

title: Into The Open
story:
Into The Open was @sid{Sydney's} birth song to me. I listened to it while carrying her as a newborn all about our hospital room, a few down from the one in which she'd entered into the world. That the song was an address from father to child - even if a distressing one - was a coincidence.

I first heard The Velvet Teen in a Lawrence, Kansas bar, on my trip in 2008, no clue what it was at the time, but determined to lift a few lines from the din and scrawl them on a scrap of paper. I forgot that capture for a while, just one scrap in a pile of many to sift through when I got home, and even then, journal entries taken on loose scraps were dropped when I originally compiled the Web page to recount the trip.

I had never heard of the band before finding out who they were through those lyrics. It's fun to think the musical fabric of the nation is unevenly distributed, such that the bands played in different regions are likewise different, even when within the same genre.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #format/mix #player/computer.07 #player/car.laura.altima #player/boombox
notes:
This is my Syd birth song. I held her as a newborn and walked about the hospital room in which she was born to this song. was laura in the room then? hey, i should check that email i sent back then.. that was fun to write.

                    learned about them through lyrics on my trip in 2008, in lawrence, kansas. the lyrics were captured on scraps that had gone forgotten for a while, for they didn't end up part of the trip web page delivered in jan that year.

                    i had never heard of the band before finding out who they were through those lyrics. fun to think that the musical fabric of the nation is unevenly distributed, such that i'm likely to learn about bands i don't know about simply by immersion in other parts of the country for intervals.

                    love that the lyrics were somewhat appropriate for a birth, or at least a parent child relationship.

                    "you'll never be much; you'll never be anything"

title: Clipping
story:
I hastily compiled a mix CD selecting exclusively from the 5 albums I bought on iTunes ahead of @sid{Sydney's} birth, listening to it in the car a lot late that summer. As good as the first Mutemath album was, they were elevating their game. 

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #format/mix #player/computer.07 #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
bought this album as one of five just ahead of sid's birth but didn't get to listening to it until much later, and even then only some selections as part of a hastily compiled mix CD i listened to in the car a lot late that summer.

                    as much as i loved their first album, they seemed to be elevating their game.

title: Sailing To Nowhere
story:
To my mind at the time, the Broken Bells album was the most perfectly organized collection of pop songs all-time. Seriously.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #player/computer.07 #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
this band is pop song genius. nothing extraneous--just perfect with each delivery.

                    the timing of that shaker, escorting the song into another mode, an outro never to be returned from... love it.

title: Love Steals Us From Loneliness
story:
@luke{Luke} and his crowd had a lot to say about Idlewild in the years prior, but it wasn't until he posted to facebook a youtube clip of Love Steals Us From Loneliness - a nostalgia piece for him and them - that I decided to give them a try for the first time, and loved it.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/youtube #player/computer.work.linux
notes:
I had never listened to Idlewild as much as Luke and his crowd seemed to have something to say about them in the years prior, but when Luke posted a clip to facebook of Love Steals Us From Loneliness, I decided to give it a try and really went for it. Still haven't heard a second song they've ever done, but I really liked this one.

                    youttube at work was primary media.

title: Beg Steal Or Borrow
story:
Beg Steal Or Borrow was my favorite song on the radio - or even in recent memory - when I was electrified to hear the opening notes rise up from the CD player on the porch at @aunt.mary{Aunt Mary's} in Manomet, during their Labor Day weekend gathering that year. @marylynn{MaryLynn} and @brumble{Josh} had done the honors, and we spoke about the album a bit when that became clear to me. @greg{Greg} crossed the porch a minute later, before the song was over, and I let him know too how much I loved it.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
this one tapped into me, made me think there was new music out there that could pull off the magic. i listened to the radio hoping for this one.

                    josh and marylynn had this cd at aunt mary's labor day weekend party.

                    greg was there, i remember sharing with him that i loved this song.

                    i had heard of this guy long ago, and knew about his stephen stills story. ray lamontagne was one of the artists jenny from indiana had suggested i listen to that night in indianapolis two years before.

title: I And Love And You
story:
Love the packing up and leaving story, an authentic American migration with poignant undertones.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
this one captured my imagination off the radio.

                    almost a crossover to vh1, though i wasn't watching so much these days.

                    liked the packing up and leaving story, with american cultural or geographical references.

                    what was their other song on the radio that might have even gotten a little bigger after this one ? head full of doubt

                    enjoyed watching their ascension.

title: Dog Days Are Over
story:
I thought Dog Days Are Over was OK, but its appearance here has more to do with that it was all over the radio at the time. In fact, that Florence doesn't even seem like the same Florence that presented a few years later. It follows that I had no idea she or they would go on to become one of my favorite artists still making music to look forward to.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
Just another radio hit in the days I wasn't tearing my music down from elsewhere.

                    nice voice.

title: Johnny Get Angry
story:
I began watching the oldies station on Music Choice TV a lot at the end of 2010, and that media - that station, in fact - would dominate my music intake for more than half a year. I did a lot of watching - or at least listening - while watching @sid{Sydney}, back when she could be left sleeping on the couch without the threat of rolling off.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.music #player/tv
notes:
I began listening to oldies on one of those TV music stations hard towards the end of 2010. I'd listen and I suppose watch while watching Syd, back when she could be left sleeping on the couch with no threat of rolling over.

                    This media - this particular station, in fact - would dominate my music intake for more than half a year. I became familiar with the sets of facts and images adding value to the music.

                    made a list of my top 10 oldies songs relative to what i used to think of them, meaning songs that i didnt know or whose greatness elevated significantly on account of me watching that channel.

title: Leader of The Band
story:
In the wake of deciding not to play out while @sean{Sean} and I had kids in 2010, I continued to visit @q{Rob} at his house most weeks through the winter and play acoustically. We started doing covers, almost exclusively 70s and 80s soft rock. I knew Leader Of The Band from the car radio in young childhood, and had heard it enough times to keep it on the radar, but hadn't given it much more than that. Turns out it was right in my wheelhouse, for both singing and sentimentality.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd.burned  #format/mix.singing #player/car.laura.altima
notes: In the wake of deciding not to play out while Sean and I had our 2010 babies, I continued to visit Rob at his house most weeks through the winter and play acoustically. We started doing a few covers, almost exclusively 70s and 80s soft rock. I knew Leader Of The Band from the car radio in young childhood and had probably heard it enough times to keep it on the radar, but I hadn't given to such focused attention as required to play it. Music starts to become something different when you look at it that way--not better or worse, just different.

title: Heaven Is In Your Mind
story:
Three Dog Night could not have rocked any harder than they did performing Heaven Is In Your Mind on some low-fi television broadcast @q{Rob} and I found on youtube. I knew @j{J} would appreciate it, given our shared appreciation of #music/artist{Traffic} and other music of the era, so I emailed him the link.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/youtube #player/computer.q.basement
notes:
Three Dog Night doing Traffic, and killing it. I had to email J when I found this track on youtube at rob's while searching for classic numbers to play for each other in deciding what we wanted to cover acoustically.

                    does anybody rock like this anymore?

title: Nothing But A Heartache
story:
I had not heard Nothing But A Heartache before catching it on oldies Music Choice TV, but it had that sound, much like the #music/artist{Marlena Shaw} song from the commercial, and maybe The 5th Dimension's #music/song{Love's Lines Angles and Rhymes}, that found a place in my gut and chest I didn't know existed, or at least kept forgetting about. On the youtube video comments they referred to it as Northern Soul, a concept I'd never encountered before.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.music #player/tv
notes:
Had never heard this one before catching it on oldies music TV, but it had that sound, much like the Marlena Shaw song from the commercial, and maybe 5th Dimension's Love's Lines Angles and Rhymes, that found a place in my gut and chest I didn't know existed. On the youtube video they referred to it as Northern Soul, a concept I'd never encountered before.

                    I followed the practice I'd used to absorb Three Dog Night's cover of Heaven Is In Your Mind and repeatedly replayed the Youtube video for this song while at work.

title: KnoXVIlle Girl
story:
An email from @jim{Jim} entitled "annual music recommendation" was just that, and delivered--I ended up listening quite a bit to Magnolia Electric Co. on the Web.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/streaming #player/computer.07
notes:
email from jim feb 11 11 titled 'Annual music recommendation':

                    ---
                    So Pandora lead me down the road to an artist/album that I never heard of, which
                    I then purchased on iTunes (technology, eh).


                    Magnolia Electric Company
                    Trials and Errors

                    Its a live album.  This dude / band sounds so much like the slow / heavy /
                    general bad ass / Neil Young & Crazy Horse style county rock (which is my
                    favorite version of Neil).  Not in a bad rip-off way (although there are some
                    song quotes), but just a style that is similar.

                    I haven't looked into other albums, but this one seriously kicks ass in my
                    opinion.  I've listened to it nonstop since getting it earlier this week.  No
                    idea it existed, but I recommend it.


                    Jim
                    ---

title: Month Of May
notes:
spoth had said in a previous year that the arcade fire was his fav band going. it took me until they went mainstream to start paying attention; i just never fell for what little i'd heard. i liked some of the music in "where the wild things are," but i never made a point to go find the rest of it.

                    the arcade fire had begun going mainstream and i found myself liking what i'd heard on the radio, but the grammy performance changed me. everybody running around, their dress, their energy, enthusiasm, that dude w/the bullhorn. it made me feel sober, steady, and determined. focused.

                    i ended up buying the album that summer.

title: Cherry Hill Park
story:
It took months of listening to oldies on Music Choice TV to hear Cherry Hill Park, but they played it pretty regularly after that. Love the scream he manages, especially in later choruses.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.music #player/tv
notes: a late find -- took months of listening to the oldies tv music station to hear this one, but they played it pretty regularly after that. love this guy's scream. and what was with mary hill?

title: Sunshine, Lollipops & Rainbows
story:
Sunshine, Lollipops & Rainbows was just one more oldies indulgence. Though I had grown up plenty familiar with oldies, I must have been changing, because it was becoming my new favorite brand of music.

I had known this song and most Lesley Gore songs that got play already, and especially loved the moodier stuff - #music/song{You Don't Own Me}, say - but I was starting to go for the happy stuff too. And I like to imagine what Lesley Gore might have meant to me had I grown up in her era. Maybe something like I felt about #music/artist{Madonna}. Or #music/artist{Debbie Gibson}. #music/artist{Belinda Carlisle} circa 6th grade. Something like that.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/tv.music #player/tv
notes: one more oldies indulgence--though I had grown up plenty familiar with it, I must have been changing, because it was becoming my new favorite brand of music. i had known this song and most Leslie Gore songs that got play already, and loved the darker stuff - You Don't Own Me, for example - but I went for the happy stuff too. plus, this girl is so pretty! I'd have had her in posters if I was a teenager when she was and singing these hits on whatever popular shows of the time would play her. i like to imagine what she would have meant if I had grown up in her era. maybe the same way i felt about madonna and belinda carlisle and debbie gibson back in 6th grade.

title: Give Up The Ghost
story:
@q{Rob} let me borrow #music/album{King Of Limbs} at some point, but I didn't end up listening until my last days at ITA. I found myself in the building on a Saturday morning around that time, weighing the gravity of leaving the job after almost 9 years. The excitement of impending freedom welled up in a single moment while listening to Give Up The Ghost, no headphones, turned way up to reach the empty nearby offices on 5.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/computer.work.linux
notes: I burned this onto my computer at work... did rob let me borrow it? or burn me a copy? I remember listening in my last days there, as Google was moving in and I was getting out. I ended up in there on a Saturday morning weighing the gravity of leaving after almost 9 years, listening to this song, without my headphones, playing it loud. Nobody else was in the office at that time, anyway. All the excitement of freedom from my job sat with me in that moment.

title: I'll Be Waiting
story:
I'll Be Waiting was easily my favorite track on the Adele album @laura{Laura} had picked up, but unfortunately Laura's 6 disc - now in the dining room on a shelf - no longer displayed track numbers properly, and had lost sensitivity on the forward seek dial, making it difficult to get at specific tracks. I willed my way to the spot reapeatedly that spring, though, in order to dance to that song with @sid{Sid} around the dining room, to get her to smile and even laugh a little, back when she was still not yet a year.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/stereo.laura.6.disc
notes: easily my favorite track on this album that laura had picked up. her 6 disc, now in the dining room on a shelf, didn't display the numbers of the tracks anymore, and it had an insensitive dial for tapping forward, as opposed to a discrete button - so it was really hard to figure out how to get to this track, but i got better at it. That spring I'd set this track and dance around the dining room with Syd to get her to smile and even laugh a little back when she was still not yet a year.

title: Will Do
story:
I caught Will Do on the radio driving somwhere near Maynard one day that summer and thought I'd found something. They told me it was TV On The Radio, who I'd heard of before, but could not have picked from a lineup.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/radio #media/itunes #format/album #player/car.laura.altima #player/laptop.11 #popular
notes: I caught this on the radio driving somwhere near Maynard one day (it reminds me of the 2 left onto 62 at that light, but i don't think that was where i first heard it) and thought I'd found something. They told me it was TV On The Radio, who I'd heard of before, but I was compelled to buy this album and find out what they were all about. especially captivated by when he goes up top after the bridge.

title: Home Is A Fire
story:
@laura{Laura} bought the latest Death Cab and left the CD in the Altima, queued to somewhere near the middle. I let it play the day I found it in there, uncertain on the track numbers given the temperamental display. Some of the songs got to me, but only one in particular--not until the dashlight came back did I learn it was the first track. I stole the disc for running my parents van between Maynard and Kingston that summer, in the process of moving back to the South Shore.

#timeline/maynard.2 #media/cd #format/album #player/car.laura.altima #current
notes:
Laura bought this CD and left it in the car somewhere near the middle. I let it keep playing on a day that the dash was out such that I couldn't read track numbers. Some of the songs got to me, but only one in particular. When listening later with the dash alight anew I discovered that the one I really liked was the first track. I made a point to steal this disc from the car to listen while making runs in my parents' van to cart our stuff from Maynard to Kingston in moving back to the south shore.

                    really liked that the structure - specifically odd, varied timings between verses and choruses - seemed to suggest that parts of the songs were tectonic plates shifting into each other like the lyrical imagery suggested.

title: The Suburbs
story:
I bought The Suburbs in the same iTunes transaction as #music/artist{TV On The Radio}, then burned a disc and listened to it in the car a ton. On an evening that summer, in the driveway outside the Kingston house to which we'd just moved, I forced @laura{Laura} to remain in the car with me for a minute so that together we could be floored by stripped down reprise The Suburbs (Continued).

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/itunes #media/cd.burned #format/album #player/laptop.11 #player/car.laura.altima #current
notes: Bought this at the time I bought TV On The Radio, copied it, and listened to it in the car a ton. I remember waiting with Laura in the driveway in Kingston so that we could hear and be flattened by the reprise of The Suburbs - The Suburbs (Continued) - at the end of the album.

title: Second Song
story:
The first track on Nine Types Of Light exceeded my hopes and expectations. I played it as much if not more than #music/song{Will Do}, for which I'd bought the album.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/itunes #format/album #player/laptop.11 #current
notes: Well the first track more than lived up to my expectations and hopes. I played this one as much if not more than Will Do, for which I bought the album.

title: Pumped Up Kicks
story:
My introduction to Pumped Up Kicks was an acoustic version on a Sunday morning radio program, no idea what it was nor that it would become so popular.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima #popular
notes: First Heard this as an acoustic version on some sunday morning unplugged style radio program - had no idea what it was nor that it was so popular - and then was really proud of myself for identifying the radio edit as something familiar before it became obvious. had me thinking that i never forget a song the way some others are with faces.

title: Bad Blood
story:
I wasn't paying much attention to the lost 45 style jam on the radio until a particular chord change in the chorus lit me up. And wait a minute, is that #music/artist{Elton John} singing backup?

Come to find out the lead was Neil Sedaka, same one I'd seen a lot of over the previous year on Music Choice TV, but in a different decade--same one as #music/song{Laughter In The Rain}. Bad Blood became a regular on youtube while working on programming projects at @rsd{Rodney's} apartment.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/youtube #player/laptop.11
notes: Heard this jam on the radio at one point that summer and made sure to listen to the lyrics so i could find it on the internet. was caught by a particular note.  Then wait a minute, is that Elton on backup? makes sense. became a regular on youtube while working at rodney's apartment.

title: Irresistible Force
story:
It was new Jane's Addiction on the radio, and they still sounded pretty good. Then it was in a TV commercial. Everybody's got to hustle.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #media/tv.commercial #player/car.laura.altima #player/tv #popular
notes: Ah, that's new Jane's Addiction on the radio, isn't it. And they still sound pretty good. Oh, and check it out, now that song is in a TV commercial. Everybody's got to hustle, right?

title: Give Me Just A Little More Time
story:
At @mcd{McDonough's} annual Turkey Cards game that year a few of us, most notably @luke{Luke} and @greg{Greg}, took to singing "give me just a little more time," first line of the chorus and title of the song.  Internet on phones taught us the name of the band responsible for the classic oldie was Chairmen Of The Board.

#timeline/kingston.1
notes: At McDonough's annual Turkey Cards game that year a few of us, most notably Luke and Greg, took to singing the chorus line, also the title of the song.  Internet on phones taught us the name of the band responsible for this classic oldie was Chairman Of The Board.

title: Paradise
story:
The new Coldplay managed to seep through the radio enough for me to catch on, despite that my lifestyle provided limited radio access. I told @laura{Laura} it sounded like they'd discovered #music/artist{Paper Route}, a sound buried in our own lives after we'd been way into them two years prior.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima #popular
notes: The new Coldplay managed to seep through the radio enough for me to catch on despite that my lifestyle provided limited radio access. I told Laura it sounded like they'd discovered Paper Route, a sound somewhat buried in our own lives after being way into them two years prior.

title: Edge Of The Moon
story:
Track ten was by far my favorite on the latest Tori album, which @laura{Laura} had purchased and left in the car. I especially loved the second half, often entering the house singing it for having just listened to it ten straight times.

When we went with @nicole.e{Nicole} to see Tori at the Orpheum that December I was hoping we'd get to hear it, and at about two thirds of the way through we did, fortunately just before Tori reached her quota of new songs.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/cd #format/album #player/car.laura.altima #current
notes:
By far my favorite song on her latest album, which Laura had purchased and left in the car. I especially love the second part of the song, and would often enter the house singing it for I'd just listened to it ten times in a row on the ride home from wherever.

                    when we went to see her that December with Nicole I hoped she'd play this. At about 2/3 of the way through the show, after almost reaching a quota of songs from the new disc, she did.

title: Surf's Up 1967 (Solo Version)
story:
@laura{Laura} knew The Beach Boys had all but become my favorite band. The previous year she DVRed a TV movie about them for me, of her own volition, and I couldn't have been happier. She also knew I was far more into what they did after they started "losing it," so to speak, and so for Christmas that year she got just about the greatest gift I'd ever gotten--the #music/album{SMiLE sessions} 5-disc set.

It had a few selections I'd known from the #music/album{Beach Boys Classics} disc I was familiar with, but a great many versions of each, plus plenty of stuff that was new to me as well. I particularly enjoyed the raw, solo version of Surf's Up, a song I'd already targeted as one of the best examples of how awesome they were.

Learning about The Beach Boys in my thirties was almost akin, unbelievably, to learning about the likes of #music/artist{Led Zeppelin} and other classic rock giants at the outset of my music fascination days, and I was grateful to have managed to defer something so enthralling, however inadvertently.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/cd #media/itunes #format/box.set #player/laptop.11 #player/car.laura.altima
notes:
smile sessions

title: Cabin Essence
story:
As the year opened I was still wrapped up in the #music/album{SMiLE} 5-disc set, particularly the final disc, a copy of the original release. Cabin Essence was the highlight, given that most of the others I was already familiar with. I endured a particularly powerful moment enjoying the song on a snowy ride home from somewhere north of the city, near the Braintree split, just as the traffic leaving the city south cleared.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/cd #media/itunes #format/box.set #player/laptop.11 #player/car.laura.altima

title: A Message
Cosmogony
story:
I caught Bjork on The Stephen Colbert Show that winter performing her new song amid a super compelling angelic choir. 

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/tv.performance #player/tv #current

title: No Light, No Light
story:
That February, @q{Rob}, @rsd{Rodney}, @sean{Sean}, and I made plans to meet at Hennessy's on an off night, ahead of a scheduled date to play their stage. I was the first to arrive. Nice place, pretty empty at the time, I took a pint and sat by myself in a booth half way to the back of the first floor.

Music played over the speakers wired throughout the room. An etherial, high-energy rock jam sung by a female with perceptible Irish accent had me feeling it. Alas, I figured it was an import appropriated by the venue and something I'd unfortunately never hear again.

Lightning struck a few months later, in the car at in the parking lot outside the church awaiting @rux{Rux} and @gina{Gina's} wedding. @laura{Laura} had gone inside, and so I was left alone with the acute realization it was the song again. I so wanted the DJ to tell me who it was, but of course they didn't--radios were robots for the most part by then. The robot did, however, follow with #music/song{Jump Into The Fog} by #music/artist{The Wombats}, which I suppose was a nice consolation.

Once in the anteroom, I recounted my story to @justin{Justin} and perhaps one other, in the hopes they could help me identify the artist. Neither could. 

I don't know why I didn't say it aloud then, but I had a strange inclination to suggest the artist might be, or at least reminded me of, Florence + The Machine. I guess I just didn't have the confidence. That's who it was, though, as I found out after it got a few more plays during my earliest days commuting to SilverRail.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/channel.venue #media/spotify #media/radio #format/album #player/sound.system #player/car.laura.altima #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Love Interruption
story:
As our band days were formally winding down, @q{Rob}, @rsd{Rodney}, @sean{Sean}, and I hashed it out on email. I made reference to Jack White's recent SNL performance, from which I drew inspiration.

A bit later, in the wake of posting the 20 year edition of this list, @mike{Mike} reached out to me in an explicit attempt to get on the next edition by telling me what music he was into, trying to relay the enthusiasm. I told him he just might get on again for mentioning Love Interruption.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #media/tv.performance #media/spotify #format/album #player/car.laura.altima #player/tv #player/laptop.11 #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Somebody That I Used To Know
story:
Somebody That I Used To Know was a bit different than most radio, and pretty much the most popular song in the world at the time. Even #music/artist{Steven Tyler} from his post on American Idol was in on it, citing the song completely unsolicited during one episode, noting its popularity while praising it as something nobody else was doing.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima #player/car.black.prius #popular

title: Take A Walk
story:
A local was getting huge airplay with Take A Walk, and I couldn't have been happier. I couldn't wait for it to come on, either - especially adrenalizing to recognize the aural tones ahead of the first percussion - as it did plenty during my earliest days commuting to SilverRail. I dug the lyrics, too, unable to detect whether the intent was irony, about investments and overdrawn accounts and other conservative concerns.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.laura.altima #player/car.black.prius #popular

title: Skin Graph
story:
Skin Graph played almost entirely and unwashed over a good several minutes of the Secret Circle season 1 finale, just another supernatural teenage-inspired television jam @laura{Laura} and I somehow found ourselves sucked into. When I posted to Facie that I couldn't believe I was starting to like the Secret Circular more than the Vampiaries, @justin{Justin} responded in disbelief that I watched either. Too bad they cut it after one season. Not bad, though, that the pretty girl became Haley on The Originals.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/tv.show #media/spotify #player/tv #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Fire Escape
story:
After completing the 20 year edition of this list - a Web page derived from the mix club app @tate{Tate}, @ryan{Ryan}, @bryan.boatner{Bryan}, and I collaborated on earlier that year - I finally got into Spotify. Given its integration with the app, and that I therefore had to learn about it, the barrier to entry was really low. And that sort of changed music for me forever. No longer was it about albums or ITunes or even Youtube, it was type-ahead search for a good percentage of all recorded music I was familiar with.

Civil Twilight's #music/album{Holy Weather} was one of my earliest experiments, and appropriately so. Fire Escape was on the radio - that was the clue - and obviously I loved their first album.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #media/spotify #format/album #player/car.black.prius #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Dirty Work
story:
@j{J} and I caught up in some Americana bar for a few beers that summer, and to watch the C's go up on Miami 3-2 in the Eastern finals that year (a series they'd eventually lose, unfortunately). J told me about the Shaw / Blades show he had recently attended, a sort of supergroup of veteran soft rockers, and let me know how into it he was. He played some for me from his car in the parking lot afterwards, and even let me keep his burned copy of their CD. I listened to it a lot on my commute after that, my favorite almost instantly turning to their cover of Steely Dan's Dirty Work.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/cd.burned #format/collection #player/car.black.prius

title: National Anthem
story:
My introduction to Lana Del Rey was her performance of Video Games on American Idol. She didn't fit in, and I was completely entranced. I may have moved even less than she did. A few months later I'd find #music/album{Born To Die} on Spotify, and it would register as a candidate among all-time favorite albums.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #current

title: Summertime Sadness
story:
At one summer league ultimate game that year I got to talking to @nick{Nick} and @wurtz{Wurtz} about the song I couldn't stop singing that night. It was Summertime Sadness, the album version, before the dance version hit the radio. I went on to explain what I had come to believe so whole heartedly about Lana Del Rey: nobody so much younger than me had ever had such power over me.

I also explained to them how bad I had become at ultimate, for example, how "open" people really truly looked to me even when they weren't. I had just grown so maladjusted to the whole exercise.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #current

title: It Don't Matter To Me
story:
Bread was always one of my favorite soft rock bands, but they went to the next level for me that summer. I discovered a few new jams, beheld familiar ones in new light, and fell really hard for the lyrics to one of my favorites, It Don't Matter To Me. That someone would so confidently impart to a lover that their "happiness is all I want for you to find", even if it cost their involvement, was beautiful. I imagined singing it to @laura{Laura} - and meaning it - and then put it on a playlist for her for Christmas that year to convey that sentiment.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/collection #format/greatest.hits #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Cold Rain
story:
I knew the 1977 release #music/album{CSN} was awesome because I knew most of the songs from the CSN box set @j{J} and I had in high school. In listening to the album itself that year I additionally discovered Cold Rain, missing from the box set, and emailed J to let him know how awesome it was too.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac

title: What The Water Gave Me
story:
@mike{Mike} and I discussed music extensively on the way up to @steve{Steve's} bachelor party in Maine that summer. We compared notes on #music/album{Blunderbuss}, but also on Florence + The Machine, whom we had both independently gotten way into. Our favorites weren't perfectly aligned, and he knew more about her first album than I did, which compelled me to dig in harder at earliest convenience. I was hooked for months.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #current

title: Hypocritical Kiss
story:
@mike{Mike} mentioned Hypocritical Kiss may have been one of his favorites from #music/album{Blunderbuss} before I got to it - back when I was still stuck on #music/song{Love Interruption} - but I eventually got to believing Hypocritical Kiss owned the album.

My musical activity that summer, particularly involving Jack White, #music/artist{Florence + The Machine}, and #music/artist{Lana Del Rey}, sowed seeds that manifested a couple years later in a Facie response to @justin{Justin}'s solicitation for ten favorite albums all time. I tagged @spoth{Spoth}, and @ruggs{Ruggs}, and eventually @toland{John}, and a chain reaction followed, circulating a lot of opinion and discussion about music amongst friends.

As for my list, I broke it down chronologically, and included #music/album{Born To Die} as my only 2010+ entry, but also honorably mentioned the other two artists, claiming these three be those I most looked forward to new material from.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac

title: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together
story:
Yeah, We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together. Like ever. 

I just loved the speaking part especially -- so relatable!

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.black.prius #popular

title: Rocket's Tail
story:
Rocket's Tail was the first song on my Christmas mix for @laura{Laura} that year, in part because it was the one I was most into at the time of making the mix, but also because I thought she would love it. She may have, guess I never really asked her about it afterwards.

At the time, I was sort of new to appreciating Kate Bush. It reminded me I had run into a girl who had performed on a night our band had, who, when I asked if she was into #music/artist{Tori}, whom I thought I heard in her music, made sure to correct me: 

No. Kate Bush.

Well, then.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: As Long As You Love Me
story:
With As Long As You Love Me, I finally fell super hard for Justin Bieber. Obviously I knew @cj{CJ} liked him before that, so he was on the radar, but still a relative unknown to me. 

One of the most important experiences with this jam was on the way back from @natale{Matt} and @nicole.k{Nicole's} house in Connecticut, where I'd gone for dinner, and to pick up Lego blocks as Christmas presents for @sid{Sid} and @annie{Annie}.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #player/car.black.prius #popular

title: Ride
story:
@luke{Luke} mentioned this end-of-the-year EP from Lana Del Rey in some public outlet, making me aware she had another jam to get all over following up on #music/album{Born To Die}.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Savin' Me
story:
Way back while @laura{Laura} and I were still living at The Beak, after @spoth{Spoth} had moved out, I was right on the verge of adding Savin' Me to this soundtrack as the last entry for '06. I said to myself that if I heard it again before New Years it was a done deal. I almost made the same deal for Pete Yorn's #music/song{For Us}, but alas, I wanted Savin' Me more. It didn't work out for either of them, however.

It wasn't until the the advent of Spotify, or more accurately, the advent of Spotify playlists, which for me didnt happen until after creating one for Laura for Christmas, after some eight or nine months of general usage, that it became really natural to target specific songs and root them in an era.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Wish You Well
story:
How on earth did I miss the boat on Grant Lee Buffalo ?

#music/song{Truly Truly} made my list of biggest radio songs of the summer in '96, and I think some friends were into this band for more than just that song, but it didn't quite penetrate. 

In '01, while living with @shawn{Shawn} in Seattle, I borrowed one of their CDs from his collection and went really hard for it, particularly for the powerful opening to #music/song{Lone Star Song}. Still, I wasn't all in. 

Some years later, while watching an episode of House with @spoth{Spoth}, a show we regularly watched at The Dike with housemates @tate{Tate} and @suz{Suz}, #music/song{Happiness} played during a poignant moment, and suddenly my time spent w/Shawn's disc came flooding back. Somehow I had forgotten the power of that disc for a few years, and so it had fallen way off the radar. Even given that reminder, however, I failed to become aware the band had yet another level to climb to.

They finally did achieve institution status for me in early 2013, when my attention turned to their full catalog. The acoustic version of Wish You Well in particular made me wish very much I had been on time for them.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/collection #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Lifeboats
story:
Upon reading the 20 year edition of this list, @pete{Pete} asked me about Snow Patrol, who he was just getting way into at around that time, to complement his #music/artist{Death Cab} obsession. My further exploration of Snow Patrol in early '13 brought to mind that line of questioning from the prior year.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Cold Morning Light
story:
That spring I went on to explore a bit more Todd Rundgren than I'd gotten from his hits and the discs @bruce{Bruce} let me borrow almost a decade prior. I wondered at the time whether @greg{Greg} had ever gotten into the less accessible parts of his catalog as well.

It was also just under a decade prior that Greg, @bill{Bill}, @j{J}, and myself decided to name a coordinated, celebratory sip of our beers "rundgrens". We devised the concept from our roundtable at the back of the Harborlights pavilion while he was performing. Etiquette was to hold up the can and make an orbit around your head while calling out "rundgren" before sloshing it down. Though the concept survived, the practice died down after only a short while. 

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Radioactive
story:
Radioactive was one of the first songs @sid{Sid} ever had her own opinion about. She liked it. For me it was a big time radio / commuting song, and ended up on some TV commercial too.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/radio #media/tv.commercial #player/car.black.prius #player/tv #popular

title: Sleep Through Summer
story:
More than once I broke the Spotify algorithms for local bands by overplaying and single-handedly floating a song to the top of the their "top tracks," simply by putting a song in a short playlist and letting it replay. This was the case for The Luxury and Sleep Through Summer, whose position on their band page I took full responsibility for. The song was a version they had posted to Spotify and that I had discovered there before an alternate mix appeared on #music/album{Bones and Beaten Heart}, which came out just a bit later.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac #local

title: Get Lucky
I Want To Touch You
story:
Catherine Wheel was a band I felt compelled to respect, even though I didn't know much about them. I got a sense they had a sort of cult following, based on a few small clues. 

I remembered #music/song{Waydown} from the radio back in '95, and so for a while I thought of them as a one hit wonder. Until I heard #music/song{Sparks Are Gonna Fly} in 2000, which I loved and therefore committed to my Napster playlists in my earliest days in Seattle. Then - and I suppose this was the real clue - I heard a radio DJ sign off for the last time from whatever station I was listening to by playing #music/song{Black Metallic} to commemorate his time there. That last one made a real impression. 

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: New Slaves
Big Brother
story:
After spending a lot of time with Kanye, I was still more into the new than the old, in contrast it seems to many of his fans, but, serendipitously, I caught Big Brother anyway, after letting my headphones run while I was away from my desk at work and then returning at just the right moment. I was floored.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Blood Bank
story:
At a bar in Lowell following @spoth{Spoth's} rehearsal dinner, Spoth, @leith{Leith}, @kipp{Kipp}, and I engaged in one of the most satisfying conversations about music I had ever had. It was facilitated by a sophisticated j-box, with extensive catalog and complex numbering system. That night was my introduction to Bon Iver. Kipp's girlfriend suggested Blood Bank, and so we played it, thereby it became the face of their sound to me.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/jukebox.once #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/venue #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Let Her Go
story:
Let Her Go was in a relatively short rotation on channel I dialed in during my overnight flight to Brisbane that year, and thus - as the only unfamiliar contribution to the soundtrack of that acute experience - its representative. Upon return to the US, the song was all over the radio, providing a regular reminder of the trip.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/channel.airplane #media/radio #player/headphones.airplane #player/car.black.prius

title: Radio cure
story:
I was devastated by #music/album{Yankee Hotel Foxtrot} at the end of that summer. I struggled to impart to @q{Rob} the hold the album had over me as I said goodbye to him and his family in his driveway, the day before they drove off to their new home in Vancouver. I told him #music/song{I am trying to break your heart} and Radio cure were the prime culprits, but the obvious distraction - filling a pod with the entirety of their remaining possessions before driving away forever - impaired the communication.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Daisyphobia
story:
When @aline{Aline} reached out to me to invite me to @rsd{Rodney's} birthday party, I jumped on the opportunity to peer in on both Rodney and @q{Rob's} new lives in Vancouver, just a week or two after they'd arrived there. I flew to Seattle and spent the night before the party with @bryan.russell{Bryan} at his place before crossing the border. 

Bryan wasn't sure what we should do that night, but one of his suggestions was to go to a show with a friend from his university program. He may have been a bit reluctant to make the suggestion initially, uncertain about whether we'd enjoy a band we'd never heard of, but I loved it -- we saw Youth Lagoon. For about a month after that I was their biggest fan, until life warped a bit and their music became something i had a hard time listening to.

#timeline/kingston.1 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #current

title: Sirens
story:
Pearl Jam made another song, and it was just popular enough to reach me, and just good enough to keep me listening enough to register on this list.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: California Nights
story:
California Nights was a revelation. It sounded like something I had heard before, but hardly ever, and certainly never enough to draw the connection to the household name of Lesley Gore. At my last Courtside karaoke birthday party, I did this number, and @ryan.s{Ryan} asked me what it was afterwards.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac #karaoke

title: My Mind Playin Tricks on Me
story:
I had heard My Mind Playin Tricks on Me before, but for some reason I got way into it that fall. I just started playing it and loving it on Spotify. At a card game a couple years later, @hatch{Hatch} demonstrated intimate familiarity with the jam when I let slip a couple of the raps and he picked up where I left off.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Normal Person
story:
I spent a lot of time with #music/album{Reflektor} in the fall of 2013. Some of the numbers had great meaning, but not rocked harder than Normal Person.

Around that time, @toland{John} mentioned he knew I'd been listening to Arcade Fire because he saw so in the margin of his Spotify app. My sense of privacy retracted accordingly.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/album #player/laptop.work.mac #current

title: Atlantis
story:
At around the same time I became especially interested in the mystery of Atlantis from a mythical perspective, I coincidentally became interested in the Donovan song about it. I also got way into other similar music from Donovan, such as #music/song{Lord of the Reedy River} and #music/song{Clara Clairvoyant}.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/album #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Aurora Gone
story:
I wasn't in the habit of noticing what my friends were listening to in the Spotify margin, but I did notice and for whatever reason jump on @leith{Leith's} Midlake, and was totally hooked. In fact, I think it skewed my sense of how effective the technique of jumping on friends' unknown to me indulgences was, spawning numerous misfires.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac

title: Southern Sun
story:
It meant something to me that Boy & Bear were from Australia, given my recent trip there. Southern Sun was a pretty big hit for them not long after I got back. I had a sense that @shawn{Shawn} liked them too, probably due to a play on a streaming station derived from a related band, a common device for ambiance at his hosted gatherings.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/radio #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/car.black.prius #player/laptop.work.mac #popular

title: Calm My Soul
story:
Calm My Soul was simply a hallmark of the era in early '14.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/spotify #format/playlist #player/laptop.work.mac #almost.current

title: Fuel to Fire
story:
Agnes Obel, like a good many artists, entered my life straight from vampire TV @laura{Laura} and I watched together. Fuel to Fire was the song that played on the episode and caught my attention, but beyond that initial offering I was also ruined by the instrumental #music/song{Falling, Catching}.

#timeline/kingston.2 #media/tv.show #media/spotify #format/album #format/playlist #player/tv #player/laptop.work.mac #popular
